subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 121042
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
342 AM PDT THU APR 12 2007

..HIGH SURF CONTINUES ON SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHERN
CALIFORNIA...

STRONG WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE COASTAL WATERS WILL GENERATE
A SOMEWHAT LARGE WESTERLY SWELL. IN ADDITION...A MODERATE SOUTHERLY
SWELL FROM A PREVIOUS STORM IN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE CONTINUES TO
IMPACT THE AREA. THIS COMBINATION OF WESTERLY AND SOUTHERLY SWELLS
WILL PRODUCE HIGH SURF ALONG THE EXPOSED SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES OF
SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK THROUGH FRIDAY
NIGHT.

CAZ040-041-121700-
/O.EXT.KLOX.SU.Y.0006.000000T0000Z-070414T0500Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
342 AM PDT THU APR 12 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT FRIDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS CONTINUED A
HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA
COUNTY. THIS ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THURSDAY.

FIVE TO SEVEN FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT THE BEACHES
OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY...ESPECIALLY AT FAVORABLY EXPOSED
SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. MAX SETS UP TO
NINE FEET ARE POSSIBLE AT THE MOST EXPOSED LOCATIONS. SURF WILL PEAK
THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AS A WIND DRIVEN SWELL IS COMBINED WITH
GUSTY WINDS NEAR AND ALONG THE SHORELINE. THE COMBINATION OF HIGH
SURF WITH THE NORTHWEST AND SOUTH SWELLS WILL ALSO PRODUCE DANGEROUS
RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES.
SURF WILL BEGIN TO SUBSIDE FRIDAY MORNING.

$$

MEIER
